unnormalised: Paytm announced a temporary service disruption affecting UPI transactions from 10:30 AM today. Users reported failed payments and delayed confirmations on various e-commerce platforms. The glitch appears to be linked to a server upgrade, according to a statement released by the company at 11:45 AM. The statement advised users to retry transactions after 12:30 PM.
normalised: Paytm announced a temporary service disruption affecting U-P-I transactions from ten thirty A-M today. Users reported failed payments and delayed confirmations on various e-commerce platforms. The glitch appears to be linked to a server upgrade, according to a statement released by the company at eleven forty five A-M. The statement advised users to retry transactions after twelve thirty P-M.

unnormalised: Many customers took to Twitter to express their frustration, citing issues with payments on Swiggy and Zomato, where they were attempting to order lunch. One user, @PriyaSharma123, tweeted "Paytm down again! Can't even order my chai. What's the point of having ₹50 cashback if I can't pay?". Another user, @TechGuruRakesh, suggested using alternative payment methods like Google Pay or PhonePe, though these also saw a slight increase in traffic.

unnormalised: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has reportedly requested a detailed report from Paytm regarding the incident. The impact is estimated to be around Rs. 5 crores in lost transaction value. Paytm stock (PAYTM:IN) saw a slight dip of 2% following the news, trading at ₹820 per share. The company anticipates full service restoration by 2:00 PM.
